column4: is the GeForce2 MX video card no longer supported with ubuntu 9.10?
you probably have to isntall the correct restricted driver , it it's an older card it,s the  nvidia 173 driver I beleive
it detected the driver as the nvidia 96, i installed it but now when it boots up it tells me that its running in low graphics mode because settings could not be detected

about your driver  the best suggestion I can offer is to check the nvidia.com website see which driver is recommended for your card , and if it is different then the one available on ubuntu , use the one from the website
ok thank you for the help, if i can't get it to work i'll just throw the card out and get something newer
throw it out in my general direction I do wonders with old hardware
its a pulled card from an old Dell and I know that Dell usually has versions of nVidia cards made for them, could this cause any problems with the ubuntu suggested driver?
most companies work like that,   it's the chipset of the card that is important,  that's what the driver is for
yeah the chipset on the card says GeForce2 MX, it doesnt even have a heat sink on it, must be a badly low end card
it'S possible it's no longer supported
no big loss if it isnt
if youcan use it wth the vesa driver why not just use it like that,   I doub'T a card that old would let you run all the compiz candy anyway
the computer its in has onboard video as well, ill just put it back to the on board and use the card in something else
if you like old hardware you would have a field day in my basement
you'll hve to quit x to install that driver,   sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
Dr_Willis. sounds good thank you for the help
